DataElement.preferredName: Patient mTOR Inhibitor Paclitaxel Carboplatin Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to  Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services related to any agents that inhibit mTOR (FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1), one of the protein kinases mediate cellular responses to stresses such as DNA damage and nutrient deprivation or a compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity or a second-generation platinum compound with a broad spectrum of antineoplastic properties.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient mTOR Inhibitor Paclitaxel Carboplatin Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to  Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services related to any agents that inhibit mTOR (FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1), one of the protein kinases mediate cellular responses to stresses such as DNA damage and nutrient deprivation or a compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity or a second-generation platinum compound with a broad spectrum of antineoplastic properties.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: mTOR Inhibitor Paclitaxel Carboplatin Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Any agents that inhibit mTOR (FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1), one of the protein kinases mediate cellular responses to stresses such as DNA damage and nutrient deprivation. mTOR acts as the target for the cell-cycle arrest and immunosuppressive effects of the FKBP12-rapamycin complex.:A compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity.  Paclitaxel binds to tubulin and inhibits the disassembly of microtubules, thereby resulting in the inhibition of cell division.  This agent also induces apoptosis by binding to and blocking the function of the apoptosis inhibitor protein Bcl-2 (B-cell Leukemia 2). (NCI04):A second-generation platinum compound with a broad spectrum of antineoplastic properties.  Carboplatin contains a platinum atom complexed with two ammonia groups and a cyclobutane-dicarboxyl residue.  This agent is activated intracellularly to form reactive platinum complexes that bind to nucleophilic groups such as GC-rich sites in DNA, thereby inducing intrastrand and interstrand DNA cross-links, as well as DNA-protein cross-links.  These carboplatin-induced DNA and protein effects result in apoptosis and cell growth inhibition.  This agent possesses tumoricidal activity similar to that of its parent compound, cisplatin, but is more stable and less toxic. (NCI04):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Any substance that inhibits mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR or FK506 binding protein 12-rapamycin associated protein 1 (FRAP1)), a serine/threonine protein kinase that is active in the control of cell growth, cell proliferation, and cell motility. Inhibition of mTOR can inhibit cell proliferation.

A compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity.  Paclitaxel binds to tubulin and inhibits the disassembly of microtubules, thereby resulting in the inhibition of cell division.  This agent also induces apoptosis by binding to and blocking the function of the apoptosis inhibitor protein Bcl-2 (B-cell Leukemia 2). (NCI04)

A second-generation platinum compound with a broad spectrum of antineoplastic properties.  Carboplatin contains a platinum atom complexed with two ammonia groups and a cyclobutane-dicarboxyl residue.  This agent is activated intracellularly to form reactive platinum complexes that bind to nucleophilic groups such as GC-rich sites in DNA, thereby inducing intrastrand and interstrand DNA cross-links, as well as DNA-protein cross-links.  These carboplatin-induced DNA and protein effects result in apoptosis and cell growth inhibition.  This agent possesses tumoricidal activity similar to that of its parent compound, cisplatin, but is more stable and less toxic. (NCI04)
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had previous
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had previous treatment with an mTOR inhibitor (sirolimus, temsirolimus, everolimus), paclitaxel, or carboplatin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior or current treatment with mTOR inhibitors or CDK 4/6 inhibitors in combination with endocrine therapy for treatment of metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior treatment with mTOR inhibitors or CDK 4/6 inhibitors in combination with endocrine therapy for treatment of metastatic disease?
